newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Matutes back to work after heart attack.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Matutes back to work after heart attack.

text.p: Spanish Foreign Minister Abel Matutes resumes work on Friday after recovering from a mild heart attack at the end of March, a ministry spokeswoman said.
"Today he'll be at the cabinet meeting and this afternoon he heads up to Vallodolid for a conference," the spokeswoman told Reuters.
She said Matutes would travel on Saturday with Prime Minister Jose Maria Aznar on his first official visit to the United States.
"We'll go to New York first...the main course (of the trip) will be the visit to Washington to President Bill Clinton," Matutes said in a radio interview this morning.
Matutes suffered a mild heart attack at the end of March and has been recuperating since than.
The foreign minister would gradually get back to a full work programme, the spokeswoman said.
